To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. Hear my voice, O God, in my prayer: preserve my life from fear of the enemy.
Hide me from the secret counsel of the wicked; from the insurrection of the workers of iniquity:
Who whet their tongue like a sword, <FI>and<Fi> bend <FI>their bows to shoot<Fi> their arrows, <FI>even<Fi> bitter words:
That they may shoot in secret at the perfect: suddenly do they shoot at him, and fear not.
They encourage themselves <FI>in<Fi> an evil matter: they commune of laying snares privily; they say, Who shall see them?<RF>matter: or, speech<Rf><RF>of…: Heb. to hide his snares<Rf>

They search out iniquities; they accomplish a diligent search: both the inward <FI>thought<Fi> of every one <FI>of them<Fi>, and the heart, <FI>is<Fi> deep.<RF>they…: or, we are consumed by that which they have throughly searched<Rf><RF>a diligent…: Heb. a search searched<Rf><CM>
But God shall shoot at them <FI>with<Fi> an arrow; suddenly shall they be wounded.<RF>shall they…: Heb. their wound shall be<Rf>
So they shall make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them shall flee away.
And all men shall fear, and shall declare the work of God; for they shall wisely consider of his doing.
The righteous shall be glad in the LORD, and shall trust in him; and all the upright in heart shall glory.<CM>
